verse:
एको देवः सर्वभूतेषु गूढः सर्वव्यापी सर्वभूतान्तरात्मा।
कर्माध्यक्षः सर्वलोकाधिवासः साक्षी चेता केवलो निर्गुणश्च॥

terms.सर्वभूतान्तरात्मा: the innermost self of all beings

meaning: Meaning:This verse describes the nature of God in Hindu philosophy. It states that there is only one God, who is hidden within all beings, omnipresent, and the innermost self of all. This God is the supervisor of all actions and resides in all realms. They are the witness and conscious being, and yet are devoid of qualities or attributes. This highlights the concept of the one ultimate reality, which is immanent and transcendent at the same time.
